alert.note: Alert for Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 1:46PM EDT until April 09 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM EDT FOR DEFIANCE...PUTNAM...PAULDING...HENRY...EASTERN WILLIAMS AND FULTON COUNTIES... At 146 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Fayette to Paulding, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Defiance, Napoleon, Bryan, Wauseon, Ottawa, Archbold, Swanton, Paulding, Delta, Leipsic, Deshler, West Unity, Kalida, Stryker, Fayette, Payne, Liberty Center, Continental, Holgate and Glandorf. This includes Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 16 and 47. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EDT for northwestern and west central Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
